Soil Issue: Visible roach atop pipeline trench with subsidence present on either side.  Tension cracks. Poorly constructed water bars.
Potential Adverse Effect: Risk of erosion and restrictions to vegetation growth.
Proposed Mitigation: Re-crown pipeline by redistributing the roach across the ROW to address contour issues.   Extend water bars across ROW width and beyond to carry water off the ROW.
Proposed Schedule: Winter 2012 with follow-up monitoring in the Summer/Fall of 2012.

Soil Issue: Subsidence and intersecting water bar leading to scouring directly above pipeline trench.
Potential Adverse Effect: Continued erosion leading to pipeline exposure.
Proposed Mitigation: Repair water bar, ensure adequate topsoil, and seed with appropriate seed mixture.
Proposed Schedule: Winter 2012 with follow-up monitoring in the Summer/Fall of 2011.

Proposed Schedule: Winter/Spring 2012 with follow-up monitoring in the Summer/Fall of 2012.

Soil Issue: Poorly constructed water bars. Unmaintained erosion control structures (straw wattles, silt fences).
Potential Adverse Effect: Continued erosion, and sedimentation of the tributary to Tupper Creek.
Proposed Mitigation: Install temporary ECS until such time that permanent measures can be completed. Extend water bars across ROW width and beyond to ensure water is carried off ROW. Repair silt fencing immediately adjacent to the tributary, reseed and restrict access until  vegetation  re-establishes. Remove straw wattles.
Proposed Schedule: Winter 2012.  Spring/Summer 2012 with follow-up monitoring in the Summer/Fall 2012.
